Check and install required packages

Source: R/utils.R
check_and_install_packages.Rd

Checks if required packages are installed and installs them if they are not. This is a more robust version of load_packages() that handles errors gracefully.

Usage

check_and_install_packages(packages, repos = getOption("repos"))

Arguments

packages

Character vector of package names to check and install.

repos

Character vector of repository URLs. Default is getOption("repos").

Value

Invisible NULL. This function is called for its side effects of checking and installing packages. Messages are printed to indicate installation progress.

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Checks if each package is installed using requireNamespace()

  2. Attempts to install missing packages using install.packages()

  3. Handles installation errors gracefully with warnings

This function is more robust than load_packages() because it:

  • Uses requireNamespace() instead of library()

  • Handles installation errors without stopping

  • Provides informative warning messages

See also

load_packages for a simpler package loading function

Examples

check_and_install_packages(c("Seurat", "dplyr", "ggplot2"))
